page.title: 14THE TAW VALE BEAGLES
page.content: The Taw Vale beagles have their headquarters at Cannington farm.There are sixty five hounds most of which are beagles and the rest are foxhounds.They belong to a group of farmers who together pay for them.It can cost up to Â£2000 a year.Feeding and caring for them takes up to about three hours a day.The dogs are given one meal a day which is usually tripe. They are given a run when their kennels are cleaned out.Hunting takes place in the autumn and there are usually three or four events a week. Young beagles are trained by chaininga young dog to an older dog until they have learned to hunt with the pack.They usually hunt hares.On a hunt day they bring the hounds to the meeting place and let them out to find the hare.
